Surf Zone Forecast
National Weather Service Tallahassee FL
204 AM EDT Tue Sep 2 2025

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

As northeast winds continue through Wednesday and overnight offshore
surges through Apalachee Bay drive up surf along Franklin county
beaches, a high risk of rip currents will continue. For the other
local beaches, a moderate risk of rip current is expected. Rain will
be hard to come by as dry air remains in place leading to partly to
mostly skies. Winds are expected to shift to the southwest after mid
week which should allow the rip current risk at Franklin County
beaches to become moderate, as well as for the other local beaches.

Surf Zone Forecast
National Weather Service Tallahassee FL
259 AM EDT Wed Sep 10 2025

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

High rip current risk at Walton and Franklin county beaches today.

Northeast offshore winds will persist today and throughout the rest of
the week, limiting the rip current risk at Emerald Coast beaches in 
the Moderate category. In contrast, Franklin County beaches will be a 
little more exposed to the the surf generated by northeast winds, so 
2 to 3-foot surf there will lead to periods of Moderate and High 
risk.

partially exposed to the northeast breezes, but strong longshore
currents will be a bigger concern than rip currents.

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

There is a high risk of rip currents for most of our beaches today.
Strong east to east-southeast winds and 2 to 3 foot surf will bring
another day of dangerous rip currents to area beaches today except for west-
facing beaches in Gulf County and the St. Joseph Peninsula State Park

easterly winds, Franklin County beaches will likely have a high rip
current risk through much of the week.

today and with residual swell in the water we'll see at least one more

moderate risk of rip currents at area beaches on Wednesday and
Thursday. Mostly dry conditions are expected but a few isolated
showers can't be ruled out.

all local beaches today. The risk increases for St George Island on
Friday as winds turn more easterly, then spreads to Bay County on
Saturday when a southeasterly shift occurs ahead of an approaching 
cold front. Walton and parts of Gulf County appear to get under a 
heightened risk by Sunday or Monday.

National Weather Service Tallahassee FL
242 AM EST Wed Nov 5 2025

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

Rip current risk through Thursday will remain confidently in the low 
to moderate range. 

On Friday and Saturday, gentle to perhaps moderate southeast breezes 
over the Gulf waters will become south and then southwest. This will 
push an increase in surf onto area beaches, but it is most likely to 
remain just below the threshold for high risk. 

Then on Sunday, westerly winds will increase in advance of a strong 
and abrupt cold front. A high risk of rip currents will develop for 
the more westerly- exposed beaches of Bay and Gulf Counties, though a 
brief time of high risk is possible for Walton County beaches too.

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

A strong front will move across coastal sections today from west to
east. Behind the front, strong northwest winds will take hold ushering
in a colder and drier airmass. A High Risk for currents is expected at
west facing Gulf county beaches and St Joseph State Park, while a
moderate risk of rip currents is expected at the other local beaches.
The coldest air of the season thus far arrives through midweek then a
gradual warming trend towards next weekend. A moderate to high risk 
of rip currents will continue through Tuesday then a primarily 
moderate risk towards late week.

Surf Zone Forecast
National Weather Service Tallahassee FL
138 AM EST Sat Dec 13 2025

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

Today, a moderate risk of rip currents is in place with light
southerly winds and surf heights around one foot. A cold front will
move through the area Sunday with winds shifting offshore and
increasing to 15 to 25 mph first along the Emerald coast then the
forgotten coast. This trajectory will drive up wave heights at west
facing Gulf County and St Joseph State Park beaches where a high risk
of rip currents can be expected. Temperatures will plummet behind the
passage with lows Monday and Tuesday mornings at the coast in the 
lower 30s.



FLZ112-132115-

offshore and increasing to 15 to 25 mph first along the Emerald coast

high risk of rip currents is in effect. Temperatures will plummet 
behind the passage with lows Monday and Tuesday mornings at the coast

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

A high risk of rip currents will exist at all area beaches today and
for the next few days. Wind and surf increase today and tonight as a
low pressure system approaches the area. Showers and isolated
thunderstorms will also increase beginning this morning. The cold
front passes through early Friday morning with southerly winds
becoming northerly behind the front and keeping surf heights elevated
into the weekend. Therefore, the high risk of rip current will
continue into Saturday. Conditions improve Sunday into early next
week.

Surf Zone Forecast
National Weather Service Tallahassee FL
207 AM EST Tue Dec 30 2025

.THE SURF ZONE FORECAST GENERAL OUTLOOK...

...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS CONTINUE AT GULF COUNTY BEACHES...

Strong post-frontal longshore flow maintains a high risk of rip 
currents at Gulf County beaches today. As the week progresses, winds 
gradually shift out of the west, thus producing an onshore flow at Bay
& Gulf County beaches. A moderate to high risk is forecast for those 
zones. By Saturday, a more widespread high risk is anticipated ahead 
of the next weather system.
